segment: Because the virus is so infectious and deadly for commercial poultry, entire flocks are destroyed and composted on the farms when they [entire flocks] are infected.

Better known as the bird flu, avian influenza is a highly contagious and deadly virus that can prey on chickens, turkeys and wild birds, including ducks and geese.
